overview:
Lee Morris is an experienced Chief Financial Officer with companies in the technology sector. He has also held several directorships.

As the CFO of FiPath (www.FiPath.com), formerly eRollover, he is responsible for all aspects of finance, legal, and human resources functions.

Most recently, Lee was the CFO of Gideon Technologies, Inc. an IT security software company (recently acquired by Symantec). He has served in a similar capacity at FleetRisk Advisors, Inc, a predictive analytics technology Company; Datatrac Corporation of Atlanta, a provider of logistics software to the transportation industry; and as Managing Director of EGL Holdings, LLC, a venture capital and corporate finance company.

Lee also served as a Director and CFO of The NetCommerce Company (Span2), a developer and marketer of software applications to insurance carriers and independent agents/brokers in the property and casualty sector; as CFO of E3 Corporation (acquired by JDA Software, Inc.), a leading worldwide provider of supply chain software and services; as the Chief Financial Officer and a Director of FormMaker Software, Inc. (later DocuCorp International, Inc.), acquired by Skywire Software, LLC, a leading provider of document automation software and services to the insurance, financial services and utility sectors; and as the Chief Financial Officer and a Director of American Technical Services Group, Inc., a leading systems provider and integrator of industrial process control systems.

After graduation with honors from Florida State University with a BS in accounting, Lee began his career with PricewaterhouseCoopers in Atlanta. He is a Charter Member of the Technology Executive Roundtable.

Lee is a native of Florida.
